question.title: Maven build not failing on failed scenarios
question.body:
After days of trying I did not find a way to let the Maven build fail if a Cucumber scenario fails. What am I missing?

Here a minimal example of that build setup. It uses Maven Wrapper to simplify things. Just have a Java 21 in your JAVA_HOME and it shall run.

Minimal Example

answers.body:
It turned out that the problem was caused by the latest versions of Surefire and Failsafe. The version 3.5.3 breaks the detection of failed scenarios somehow. Everything runs fine with version 3.5.2.
I do not know who to blame for this but let's see what the future brings.

question_comments.body: Its less an issiue of the linked code changing (we can trivally edit the link to go to a specific commit instead) but 1) a copyright problem (the linked repository doesn't have a repo license, which means we must assume standard all-rights-reserved) and 2) the repository, as far as SO users control it, might disappear at any time, leaving nothing usefull in this question.

I am not sure, why this question was closed.  The desired behavior is obvious. It is already noted in the title. Obviously, I expect the Maven build to fail if a scenario fails.  The specific problem is also noted there. The Maven build does not fail if a scenario fails.  And the shortest code is present as a simple example. Since this is a build setup that requires some file in a directory structure, sharing a repo link is useful. Yes, it is a link, and the latest commit may change. But the original problem will not change, it is a Git repo with history.

79708949.body: Would have been nice to make this clear in your question! Anyway, by default The Failsafe Plugin will not fail the build during the integration-test phase....
Surefire for simple unit tests and Failsafe for integration tests. Depending on what the tests are doing they belong to the Maven test phase (Surefire) or the Maven verify phase (Failsafe).
Just curious: why are you using both surefire and failsafe?
